The Annotated Civilisation:  VI. Music

November 21, 2020

Periods

A.  MEDIEVAL : Richard Cœur de Lion

B.  RENAISSANCE : Landini—Queldryk—Dunstaple—Dufay—Isaac—Josquin—Fogliano—Verdelot—Janequin—Victoria—Gabrieli—Dowland—Farnaby—Francisque—Tomkins

C.  BAROQUE : Monteverdi—Praetorius—Schein—Lully—Buxtehude—Purcell—Pepusch—Handel—Bach—Mudge

D.  CLASSICAL : Haydn—Viotti—Mozart—Rouget de Lisle—Hewitt—Beethoven

E.  ROMANTIC : Schubert—Berlioz—Franck—Brahms—Tchaikovsky—Strauss

F.  MODERN : Debussy—Ives—Stravinsky—Walton—Messiaen

G.  POPULAR

#chronology


A.  Medieval

“Aeterne rerum conditor” (Ambrosian chant)  ♬  Pfalzkapelle  [1]

Carmina Burana: “Fas et nefas ambulant” CB 19  ♬  Building the Tower of Babel, from the Vitae duorum Offarum | Construction de la tour de Babel  [2]

Carmina Burana: “Estivali sub fervore” CB 79  ♬  Abbaye de Vézelay  [2]

Carmina Burana: “Veris dulcis in tempore” CB 85  ♬  Virgin and Child from the Sainte-Chapelle | The Two Maries at the sepulchre | Descente de croix  [3]

“C’est la fin” (with Breton bombard)  ♬  Château d’Angers | Château de Blois | Château de Sully-sur-Loire  [3]

“Pour mon cœur”  ♬  Mirror cases: A Hunting Party | Attack on the Castle of Love | The Elopement | Casket with Scenes of Romances  [3]

“Ja nuns hons pris” (attr. Richard Cœur de Lion)  ♬  Livre du cœur d’Amour épris  [3]

The Song of the Ass  ♬  Giotto’s frescoes in the Cappella degli Scrovegni, Padova  [3]

“Worldes blis”  ♬  Giovanni Pisano, Pulpito del duomo di Pisa  [3]

“Lamento di Tristan”  ♬  Royal Gold Cup  [3]

“Trotto”  ♬  Les Très Riches Heures du duc de Berry  [3]

“Alta”  ♬  La Dame à la licorne  [3]

“Victimae paschali laudes” (sequence)  ♬  Ambon of Henry II | Gero Cross | Skellig Michael  [1]

“Lumen ad revelationem. Nunc dimittis” (antiphon)  ♬  Gero Cross | Ramsey Psalter | The Evangeliary of Uta (Uta Codex) | Panel from a book cover (Lotharingian, late 10th century)  [1]

“Ubi caritas et amor, Deus ibi est” (antiphon)  ♬  Canterbury Cathedral  [2]

“Virgo prudentissima” (antiphon)  ♬  Abbaye Notre-Dame d’Aiguebelle  [2]

“Dominus dixit ad me” (introitus)  ♬  Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Chartres  [2]

“Cum natus esset Jesus”  ♬  Abbaye de Vézelay  [2]

“Alleluia. Assúmpta est Maria”  ♬  Cathédrale Saint-Lazare d’Autun  [2]

“O Redemptor sume carmen”  ♬  Basilica di San Francesco in Assisi  [3]

Kyriale: Mass II (Kyrie fons bonitatis), “Kyrie”  ♬  Basilique Cathédrale de Saint-Denis | Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Chartres  [2]

Kyriale: Mass III (Kyrie Deus sempiterne), “Sanctus”  ♬  Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Chartres  [2]

Ad Completorium in Nativitate Domini: “Nunc dimittis” (Canticum Simeonis) & “Salva nos” (antiphon)  ♬  Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore  [7]

#contents


B.  Renaissance

“Très douce regard” (Bird-call virelai)  ♬  Sandro Botticelli, Nascita di Venere | Madonna della Melagrana  [4]

“Mij quam eyn hope” (Flemish)  ♬  Jan van Eyck, Portrait of Margaret van Eyck | Portrait of Cardinal Niccolò Albergati | Portrait of Giovanni di Nicolao Arnolfini | Portrait of a Man with Carnation | Portrait of a Man in a Red Turban | Arnolfini Portrait  [4]

“Venid a sospirar” (Spanish)  ♬  Tiziano Vecellio (Titian), Le Concert champêtre | Giorgione, La Tempesta  [4]

La Spagna  ♬  Fra Carnevale, The Ideal City of Baltimore | Luciano Laurana, Francesco di Giorgio Martini, or Melozzo da Forlì, The Ideal City of Urbino | Baccio Baldini, Mercury from The Planets  [4]

Pavane & Pavane “La garde”  ♬  Andrea Mantegna’s frescoes in the Camera degli Sposi of the Palazzo Ducale, Mantova  [4]

[LANDINI]  “Gram piant’ agli ochi”  ♬  Lorenzo Ghiberti, Gates of Paradise from the Battistero di San Giovanni: The Story of Adam and Eve | Michelangelo, Tondo Pitti | Donatello, David  [4]

[LANDINI]  “Ecco la primavera”  ♬  Sandro Botticelli, Primavera  [4]

[QUELDRYK]  “Gloria in excelsis”  ♬  Cappella dei Pazzi  [4]

[DUNSTAPLE]  “Veni sancte spiritus”  ♬  Battistero di San Giovanni di Pisa | Duomo di Pisa  [3]

[DUFAY]  “Vexilla regis prodeunt”  ♬  Masaccio’s frescoes in the Cappella Brancacci of the Basilica di Santa Maria del Carmine  [4]

[ISAAC]  “Sempre giro piangendo”  ♬  Lorenzo Ghiberti, Gates of Paradise from the Battistero di San Giovanni: The Story of Jacob and Esau | Donatello’s reliefs from the High Altar of the Basilica di Sant’Antonio, Padova: Miracle of the Repentant Son & Miracle of the Ass  [4]

[ISAAC]  La morra  ♬  Zanobi Strozzi, The Abduction of Helen  [5]

[ISAAC]  Proprium missae in Dominica laetare: Introitus. Laetare Jerusalem  ♬  Raphael’s frescoes in the Stanze di Raffaello of the Palazzo Apostolico, Vaticano: The School of Anthens | The Expulsion of Heliodorus from the Temple | The Disputation of the Holy Sacrament | The Parnassus | The Mass at Bolsena  [5]

[ISAAC, 1487]  A la battaglia  ♬  Andrea Mantegna, Triumphs of Caesar: The Vase Bearers  [5]

[JOSQUIN, 1497]  “Nymphes des bois” (La Déploration sur la mort de Jean Ockeghem)  ♬  Hubert and Jan van Eyck, The Adoration of the Mystic Lamb in the Ghent Altarpiece | Giovanni Bellini, Agony in the Garden | Cappella dei Pazzi  [4]

[JOSQUIN, 1503]  “Ave verum”  ♬  Biblioteca di San Marco | Basilica di Santa Croce | Battistero di San Giovanni | Basilica di Santa Maria delle Carceri | Leonardo da Vinci, Uomo vitruviano, or Le proporzioni del corpo umano secondo Vitruvio  [4]

[FOGLIANO]  “L’amor donna”  ♬  Palazzo Ducale, Urbino  [4]

[VERDELOT, 1533]  “Madonna, il tuo bel viso”  ♬  Palazzo Ducale, Urbino | Piero della Francesca, Flagellazione di Cristo (Flagellation of Christ)  [4]

[JANEQUIN, 1530]  “Chantons, sonnons trompetes”  ♬  Palazzo Ducale, Urbino  [4]

[JANEQUIN, 1535]  “Martin menoit son pourceau au marché”  ♬  Palazzo Vecchio | Palazzo Medici Riccardi | Palazzo Davanzati | Cappella dei Pazzi  [4]

[PALESTRINA]  Lamentationum (Lamentationes Jeremiae Prophetae): Liber III, Sabbato Sancto, Lectio III “Incipit oratio Jeremiæ prophetæ. Recordare”  ♬  Michelangelo, The Last Judgment  [7]

[VICTORIA, 1585]  Tenebrae Responsories: XVII. Aestimatus sum  ♬  Michelangelo, Awakening Slave | Young Slave | Bearded Slave | Sistine Chapel ceiling | Last Judgment | David  [5,13]

[GABRIELI, 1597]  “Nunc dimittis”, Ch. 50  ♬  Colonnades, Piazza San Pietro  [7]

[GABRIELI, 1597]  Canzon per sonar primi toni à 8, Ch. 170  ♬  Michelangelo, Separation of the Earth from the Waters, from the Sistine Chapel ceiling | Raphael, The School of Anthens | Colosseum, or Flavian Amphitheatre | Piazza Navona & Chiesa di Sant’Agnese in Agone | Pantheon | Equestrian Statue of Marcus Aurelius | Ponte Fabricio | Ponte Sant’Angelo | Castel Sant’Angelo | Basilica Papale di San Pietro & Piazza San Pietro | Giovanni Paolo Pannini, Interior of Saint Peter’s, Rome | Gian Lorenzo Bernini, Cattedra & Baldacchino di San Pietro  [5,7]

[DOWLAND]  Melancholy Galliard  ♬  Château de Montaigne | Little Moreton Hall  [6]

[FARNABY]  His Rest, FVB 195  ♬  Kirby Hall  [6]

[TOMKINS]  Voluntary in C major  ♬  Magdalen College, Oxford | Hans Holbein der Jüngere, Portraits of Erasmus of Rotterdam  [6]

[FRANCISQUE, 1600]  Le trésor d’Orphée: Pavane et bransles  ♬  Antoine Watteau, Les Champs Elysées | Studies of Nine Heads | Studies of a Woman Playing a Guitar, or Holding a Musical Score | Two Studies of a Man Playing the Guitar and a Study of a Man’s Right Arm | Les Fêtes vénitiennes | Gilles | Embarquement pour Cythère | Peaceful Love | Les Charmes de la Vie | The Music Lesson | Gilles and His Family  [9]

[PRAETORIUS, 1612]  Dances from Terpsichore: Ballet, TMA 268  ♬  Jacob van Ruisdael, View of Haarlem with Bleaching Grounds | Gerrit Berckheyde, The Market Place and the Grote Kerk at Haarlem | Grote of St.-Bavokerk, Haarlem  [8]

#contents


C.  Baroque

[MONTEVERDI, 1607]  L’Orfeo, SV 318: Toccata  ♬  Basilica Papale di San Pietro & Piazza San Pietro | Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore  [7]

[MONTEVERDI, 1610]  Vespro della Beata Vergine, SV 206: I. “Domine ad adiuvandum”  ♬  Basilica Papale di San Pietro  [7]

[MONTEVERDI, 1610]  Vespro della Beata Vergine, SV 206: II. “Dixit Dominus”  ♬  Ending titles  [7]

[MONTEVERDI, 1610]  Vespro della Beata Vergine, SV 206: XI. “Sancta Maria”  ♬  Andrea Pozzo, Gloria di Sant’Ignazio | Giovanni Battista Gaulli, Trionfo del Nome di Gesù  [7]

[MONTEVERDI, 1610]  Vespro della Beata Vergine, SV 206: XIII. “Magnificat: Deposuit potentes & Gloria Patri”  ♬  Gian Lorenzo Bernini, La famiglia Corner assiste all’estasi di santa Teresa | Estasi di santa Teresa d’Avila  [7]

[MONTEVERDI, 1610]  Vespro della Beata Vergine, SV 206: XIII. “Magnificat: Sicut erat in principio”  ♬  Galleria delle carte geografiche  [7]

[SCHEIN, 1617]  Banchetto musicale, Suite No. 4 in G major: II. Gagliarda à 5  ♬  Frans Hals, Officers and Sergeants of the St George Civic Guard | Meeting of the Officers and Sergeants of the Calivermen Civic Guard | Banquet of the Officers of the Calivermen Civic Guard | Regents of the Old Men’s Almshouse | Jan de Bray, The Regents of the Children’s Orphanage in Haarlem  [8]

[LULLY]  Les musiciens du roi: IV. Fanfare (allegretto)  ♬  Château de Versailles  [10]

[BUXTEHUDE]  Toccata in F major, BuxWV 157  ♬  Christiaan Müller Organ in the Grote of St.-Bavokerk, Haarlem  [9]

[BUXTEHUDE]  Prelude in G minor, BuxWV 163  ♬  Canals of Amsterdam | Johann Jakob Walther, Tulips from Horti Itzeinensis or the Nassau Florilegium | Justus van Huysum, Stilleven van tulpen en andere bloemen in een vaas op een piëdestal | Hans Bollongier, Stilleven met bloemen (Floral Still Life)  [8]

[BUXTEHUDE]  Suite in C major, BuxWV 230: III. Sarabande  ♬  Johannes Vermeer, The Music Lesson | The Lacemaker | Woman Reading a Letter | Woman Holding a Balance  [8]

[PURCELL, 1691]  The Gordion Knot Unty’d, Z. 597: I. Overture  ♬  St Paul’s Cathedral  [8]

[PURCELL, c. 1683–8]  Dido and Aeneas, Z. 626: Act III, “Come Away, Fellow Sailors”  ♬  Jacob van Ruisdael, Beach View | Jan van de Cappelle, A Shipping Scene with a Dutch Yacht Firing a Salute | Willem van de Velde de Jonge, A Dutch Yacht Saluting | English Ships at Sea Beating to Windward in a Gale | A Small Dutch Vessel Close-Hauled in a Strong Breeze | The Resolution in a Gale  [8]

[PURCELL, c. 1694]  Sonata for Trumpet and Strings in D major, Z. 850: I. Allegro & III. Allegro  ♬  Old Royal Naval College | James Thornhill, ceiling of the Painted Hall  [8]

[PEPUSCH, 1728]  The Beggar’s Opera: Act III, “Since Laws Were Made”  ♬  William Hogarth, A Rake’s Progress: 6. The Rake at the Gaming House  [10]

[HANDEL, 1735]  Alcina, HWV 34: Act I, “Questo è il cielo de’ contenti”  ♬  Ceiling of the Würzburger Residenz  [9]

[HANDEL, 1742]  Messiah, HWV 56: Part III, No. 45. “I Know That My Redeemer Liveth”  ♬  Giambattista Tiepolo, Christ Carrying the Cross  [9]

[HANDEL, 1739]  Concerto Grosso in G major, Op. 3, No. 3, HWV 314: I. Largo, e staccato – allegro  ♬  Schloss Nymphenburg  [9]

[HANDEL, 1749]  Music for the Royal Fireworks, HMW 351: VI. Menuets II  ♬  Blenheim Palace  [10]

[BACH, 1727]  Matthäus-Passion, BWV 244: Part II, No. 58a. Evangelist “Und da sie an die Stätte kamen” & No. 58b. Chorus I/II “Der du den Tempel Gottes zerbrichst”  ♬  Kloster Ottobeuren  [9]

[BACH, 1734]  Weihnachts-Oratorium, BWV 248: Part I, No. 1. Chorus “Jauchzet, frohlocket, auf, preiset die Tage”  ♬  Basilika Vierzehnheiligen  [9]

[MUDGE, 1749]  Concerto No. 1 in D major for Trumpet and Strings: III. Larghetto andante  ♬  Chiswick House  [10]

#contents


D.  Classical

[VIOTTI/ROUGET DE LISLE, 1781/92]  La Marseillaise, ou Chant de guerre pour l’armée du Rhin  ♬  Arc de Triomphe | François Rude, Le Départ des volontaires de 1792  [12]

[MOZART, 1782]  String Quartet No. 14 in G major, K. 387: IV. Molto allegro  ♬  Norfolk House Music Room  [9]

[MOZART, 1785]  Piano Quartet No. 1 in G minor, K. 478: III. Rondo (allegro)  ♬  Michel-Barthélémy Ollivier, Le Thé à l’anglaise dans le salon des quatre glaces au Temple, avec toute la cour du Prince de Conti, écoutant le jeune Mozart  [10]

[MOZART, 1787]  Don Giovanni, K. 527: Act I, “Notte e giorno faticar” – “Non sperar, se non m’uccidi, Ch’io ti lasci fuggir mai!” – “Ah, vendicar, se il puoi, giura quel sangue ognor!” & Act II, “Questo è il fin di chi fa mal”  ♬  Cuvilliés-Theater | Felsenreitschule  [9]

[MOZART, 1791]  String Quintet No. 6 in E-flat major, K. 614: III. Menuetto (allegretto)  ♬  Comédie-Française | Marguerite-Fanny Dubois-Davesnes, Buste de Marivaux | Jean-Antoine Houdon, Voltaire  [10]

[HEWITT, 1797]  Piano Sonata No. 1 in D major (The Battle of Trenton): “Yankee Doodle”  ♬  Jean-Antoine Houdon, George Washington | John Trumbull, The Death of General Warren at the Battle of Bunker’s Hill, 17 June 1775 | The Death of General Mercer at the Battle of Princeton, 3 January 1777 | Surrender of Lord Cornwallis | Washington Monument  [10]

[HAYDN, 1798]  Die Schöpfung, Hob. XXI/2: No. 30. “Von deiner Güt’, o Herr und Gott”  ♬  Wallfahrtskirche zum Gegeißelten Heiland auf der Wies (Wieskirche)  [9]

[HAYDN, 1799]  String Quartet No. 66 in G Major, Op. 77 (Lobkowitz), No. 1, Hob. III/81: I. Allegro moderato  ♬  Amalienburg  [9]

[BEETHOVEN, 1803]  Concerto for Violin, Cello, and Piano in C major, Op. 56 (Triple Concerto): II. Largo (attacca)  ♬  Fountains Abbey | Alpine landscapes  [11]

[BEETHOVEN, 1804]  Symphony No. 3 in E-flat major, Op. 55 (Eroica): II. Marcia funebre. Adagio assai  ♬  Anne-Louis Girodet, Ossian Receiving the Ghosts of French Heroes | Jacques-Louis David, La Distribution des aigles | Tomb of Napoléon Bonaparte in the Dôme des Invalides  [12]

[BEETHOVEN, 1806]  Leonoren-Ouvertüre Nr. 3, Op. 72b  ♬  Osterley House  [12]

[BEETHOVEN, 1814]  Fidelio, Op. 72: Act I, “O welche Lust” (Prisoners’ Chorus)  ♬  Château de Vincennes | Attack to Caserne Babylone of the Swiss Guards, Rue de Babylone, Paris 1831 (print) | Revolución Gloriosa España. Fight Barricade Quarter de Los Vinas, Cadiz 1868 (print) | Revolution in Prussia. Conflict before the Royal Palace, Berlin 1848 (print) | Barricade at the Corner of the Boulevard, Rue de Mazagran, near the Porte Saint-Denis, Paris 1848 (print) | Eugène Sevaistre, La batteria Conca, Gaeta, Italy 1860–1861 (photo)  [12]

#contents


E.  Romantic

[SCHUBERT, 1819]  Piano Quintet in A major, D. 667 (Trout Quintet): II. Andante  ♬  John Constable, The Leaping Horse | Barges on the Stour with Dedham Church in the Distance | Dedham Lock and Mill (sketch) | Flatford Mill from a Lock on the Stour | Spring: East Bergholt Common | Study for Branch Hill Pond: Hampstead  [11]

[BERLIOZ, 1831]  Le Roi Lear, Op. 4  ♬  Théodore Géricault, Le Radeau de La Méduse  [12]

[TCHAIKOVSKY, 1876]  Francesca da Rimini: Symphonic Fantasy after Dante, Op. 32  ♬  Auguste Rodin, La Porte de l’Enfer  [12]

[BRAHMS, 1880]  Tragische Ouvertüre, Op. 81  ♬  J. M. W. Turner, Mer de Glace, in the Valley of Chamouni, Switzerland | The Fall of an Avalanche in the Grisons | Snow Storm: Mont Cenis | Snow Storm: Hannibal and His Army Crossing the Alps | Valley of Aosta, Snowstorm, Avalanche, and Thunderstorm  [11]

[BRAHMS, 1887]  Concerto for Violin and Cello in A minor, Op. 102 (Double Concerto): II. Andante  ♬  Rydal Water  [11]

[FRANCK, 1890]  Organ Chorale No. 3 in A minor, FWV 40  ♬  Michelangelo, David | Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Chartres | Sandro Botticelli, Primavera | Sherry-Netherlands & General Motors Building | Basilica Papale di San Pietro & Piazza San Pietro | St Paul’s Cathedral | Arc de Triomphe & Avenue des Champs-Élysées | Hôtel des Invalides | Palais du Louvre & Jardin des Tuileries | Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Paris  [1]

[STRAUSS, 1895]  Till Eulenspiegels lustige Streiche, Op. 28, TrV 171  ♬  Auguste Rodin, Monument à Balzac  [12]

[STRAUSS, 1913]  Festliches Präludium, Op. 61, TrV 229  ♬  Auguste Rodin, Les Bourgeois de Calais  [12]

#contents


F.  Modern

[IVES, 1892]  Variations on “America”  ♬  Thomas Jefferson Memorial | United States Capitol | United States Supreme Court | Washington Monument  [10]

[DEBUSSY, 1899]  Nocturnes, CD 98, L. 91: I. Nuages  ♬  J. M. W. Turner, Norham Castle, Sunrise | Sunrise, with a Boat Between Headlands | Yacht Approaching the Coast | Spring Tour of Northern France, 1845 | Claude Monet, Les Nymphéas : Le Matin aux saules | Les Deux saules | Le Matin clair aux saules | Reflets verts | Soleil couchant  [11]

[DEBUSSY, 1905]  La mer, trois esquisses symphoniques pour orchestre, CD 111, L. 109: I. De l’aube à midi sur la mer  ♬  J. M. W. Turner, Seascape with Storm Coming On | A Wreck, with Fishing Boats | Rough Sea | Breakers on a Flat Beach | Waves Breaking on a Lee Shore at Margate (Study for Rockets and Blue Lights) | Rough Sea with Wreckage | Stormy Sea with Blazing Wreck | A Ship Aground, Yarmouth; Sample Study | Study of Sea and Sky, Isle of Wight  [11]

[STRAVINSKY, 1928]  Apollon musagète: X. Apothéose  ♬  Saltwood Castle | Manhattan Bridge & Brooklyn Bridge | Sarcophagus of Napoleon Bonaparte in the Dôme des Invalides | Fountains Abbey | Monticello | Basilika Vierzehnheiligen | Old Royal Naval College | Piazza San Pietro | Little Moreton Hall | Urbino | Basilica di San Francesco d’Assisi | Canterbury Cathedral | Skellig Michael  [13]

[WALTON, 1935]  Symphony No. 1 in B-flat minor: I. Allegro assai  ♬  Brooklyn Bridge | Skyline of Lower Manhattan | George Washington Bridge | Statue of Liberty | Wollman Rink in Central Park  [13]

[MESSIAEN, 1939]  Les Corps glorieux: IV. Combat de Mort et de la Vie  ♬  Praw of a Viking ship  [1]

G.  Popular

“Will Ye Go to Sheriffmuir”  ♬  Landscape of Edinburgh  [10]

Le champ d’Honneur (fanfare)  ♬  Henri Félix Emmanuel Philippoteaux, Bonaparte à la bataille de Rivoli | Château de Malmaison  [12]

Chronology of Composers

RICHARD CŒUR DE LION
  (English, 1157–1199)

FRANCESCO LANDINI
  (Italian, 1325/35–1397)

QUELDRYK
  (English, fl. c. 1400)

JOHN DUNSTAPLE
  (English, c. 1390–1453)

GUILLAUME DUFAY
  (Flemish, c. 1397–1474)

HEINRICH ISAAC
  (Flemish, c. 1450–1517)

JOSQUIN DES PRÉS
  (French, c. 1450/5–1521)

GIACOMO FOGLIANO
  (Italian, c. 1468–1548)

PHILIPPE VERDELOT
  (French, c. 1480/5–1530/52)

CLÉMENT JANEQUIN
  (French, c. 1485–1558)

GIOVANNI PIERLUIGI DA PALESTRINA
  (Italian, c. 1525–1594)

TOMÁS LUIS DE VICTORIA
  (Spanish, c. 1548–1611)

GIOVANNI GABRIELI
  (Italian, c. 1554/7–1612)

JOHN DOWLAND
  (English, c. 1563–1626)

GILES FARNABY
  (English, c. 1563–1640)

CLAUDIO MONTEVERDI
  (Italian, 1567–1643)

ANTOINE FRANCISQUE
  (French, c. 1570–1605)

MICHAEL PRAETORIUS
  (German, c. 1571–1621)

THOMAS TOMKINS
  (Welsh–English, 1572–1656)

JOHANN HERMANN SCHEIN
  (German, 1586–1630)

JEAN-BAPTISTE LULLY
 [Giovanni Battista Lulli]
  (Italian–French, 1632–1687)

DIETRICH BUXTEHUDE
 [Diderik Buxtehude]
  (Danish–German, 1637/9–1707)

HENRY PURCELL
  (English, 1659–1695)

JOHANN CHRISTOPH PEPUSCH
  (German–English, 1667–1752)

GEORGE FRIDERIC HANDEL
 [Georg Friedrich Händel]
  (German–English, 1685–1759)

JOHANN SEBASTIAN BACH
  (German, 1685–1750)

RICHARD MUDGE
  (English, 1718–1763)

FRANZ JOSEPH HAYDN
  (Austrian, 1732–1809)

GIOVANNI BATTISTA VIOTTI
  (Italian, 1755–1824)

WOLFGANG AMADEUS MOZART
  (Austrian, 1756–1791)

CLAUDE JOSEPH ROUGET DE LISLE
  (French, 1760–1836)

JAMES HEWITT
  (American, 1770–1827)

LUDWIG VAN BEETHOVEN
  (German–Austrian, 1770–1827)

FRANZ SCHUBERT
  (Austrian, 1797–1828)

HECTOR BERLIOZ
  (French, 1803–1869)

CÉSAR FRANCK
  (Belgian–French, 1822–1890)

JOHANNES BRAHMS
  (German, 1833–1897)

PYOTR ILYICH TCHAIKOVSKY
 [Пётр Ильи́ч Чайко́вский]
  (Russian, 1840–1893)

CLAUDE DEBUSSY
  (French, 1862–1918)

RICHARD STRAUSS
  (German, 1864–1949)

CHARLES IVES
  (American, 1874–1954)

IGOR STRAVINSKY
 [Игорь Стравинский]
  (Russian–French–American, 1882–1971)

WILLIAM WALTON
  (English, 1902–1983)

OLIVIER MESSIAEN
  (French, 1908–1992)

#contents

APOLOGY : A few pieces of chorus and early music are, unfortunately, beyond my identification power at the present time.
